description: Numbers n such that 10n - 3 is prime.
comments: Solutions of the equation (10*n-3)' = 1, where n' is the arithmetic derivative of n. [_Paolo P. Lava_, Jan 03 2013]
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: a={};Do[x=10*n-3;If[PrimeQ[x],AppendTo[a,n]],{n,10^2}];a - _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Apr 29 2008Select[Range[200], PrimeQ[10#-3]&] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Nov 22 2012 *)
author: _Clark Kimberling_
